title: Application description
content:
Web Blog Post is an simple app for reading, writing, editing and deleting blog posts. Web Blog Post is built using Node.js and Express.

-- Key features and functionalities of the program--
Imported Modules:
The program imports several modules, including express, path, fs/promises for asynchronous file operations, body-parser for parsing request bodies, and ejs as the view engine.

Express Setup:
An Express application is created, and middleware like express.static and body-parser is used to handle static files and parse JSON and URL-encoded data in requests.

View Engine Setup:
EJS (Embedded JavaScript) is set as the view engine for rendering dynamic HTML templates.

Routing:
Various routes are defined using app.get and app.post for handling different HTTP requests.
Routes include home (/ and /home), creating a new post (/newpost), searching (/search), browsing posts (/browse), retrieving post content (/getPostContent/:id), submitting a new post (/submit), deleting a post (/deletePost/:id), updating post views (/updateViews/:id), and editing a post (/editPost/:id).

File Operations:
The program reads and writes posts data from/to a JSON file (posts.json) asynchronously using fs/promises.
The posts.json file contains an array of post objects, each with properties like id, date, time, title, content, author, email, editable, and views.

Error Handling Middleware:
A custom error-handling middleware is implemented to log errors and send a 500 Internal Server Error response.

Rendering Views:
Views are rendered using EJS templates located in the views directory.
The res.render method is used to render HTML views and pass data to the templates.

Utility Functions:
There is a utility function getDate to generate a formatted date and time string for post submissions.

Listening for Requests:
The Express application listens on a specified port (3000 in this case) for incoming HTTP requests.

Overall, the program is a basic web application with CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for posts, user interactions, and dynamic rendering of HTML views using the EJS templating engine.
